alert.note: Alert for Santa Clara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 9:09AM PST until March 10 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Flooding continues on the Uvas Creek. Southbound lanes of California Highway 101 are closed in the Gilroy area. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, San Benito. In northern California, Santa Clara. * WHEN...Until 200 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Southbound lanes of California Highway 101 are closed in the Gilroy area. Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. This includes the Uvas creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 906 AM PST, Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gilroy. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away.
